summary: The 'Say No to Indoctrination Act' (S. 2251) aims to amend the Elementary and Secondary Education Act of 1965. The bill seeks to prohibit the use of federal funds under the act to teach or promote concepts related to "gender ideology." It references Executive Order 14168, which addresses defending women from "gender ideology extremism" and restoring "biological truth." The bill was introduced in the Senate and referred to the Committee on Health, Education, Labor, and Pensions.
